content: The the best poker equity calculator there is. I give it a downgrade due to the interface. The app is a bit clunky to use, and visually underwhelming. If the UI was anywhere near the functionality, this app would be an absolute masterpiece. Still very happy with this purchase.
replyContent: Thanks for your thoughtful review with both good and bad points. Re. the UI, it was a conscious decision to go with a simple no-frills UI, we felt this would make the cards and stats and numbers and features stand out better (e.g., the simple all-black screen background). We're glad you like the features and power. Regards, -RJ/PokerCruncher, LLC

content: It pretends like advanced poker calculator but in fact its just a regular poker calculator of which there are many free in google play. They say they have videos and tutorials but its all about mac version of this app. It said in description : flop texture analysis, and many stats for serious strategy analysis. Flop texture analysis is useless and they dont have more stats.
replyContent: Some complete falsehoods, you must not have looked at this app & tutorial closely enough. Written tutorial describes all of this app's features. Flop texture analysis useless?, you gotta be kidding. And you have to tap <- and -> buttons in Stats view to see the 3 pages of stats. Anyone who understands this app will consider it advanced. Good luck.

content: There's something fishy going on here. It's me. Played with this App for 2 mins and fell in love with it. Update:~ it's lost a star. It's good for smart phones but personally I find the buttons a bit too small and neithet they, or the screen, get any bigger on a tablet. It's also stuck in portrait mode, so not ideal for tablets.

Although I expect this is the same app that runs on a cellphone, I am actually running it on a chromebook. It would be nice to make use of the more spacious screen. The user interface is somewhat cumbersome but the app does function as described - actually even better. Although taking me more time than it should, it does the job and does it well. (My previous negative review was a mistake. It was intended for another app developer - not this one. This developer is actually very responsive.)
replyContent: REPLY 2: This is a phone-layout app as the screenshots show. A desktop-screen app would be a completely different ballgame. We have Mac(Expert) and iPad versions, but not Android/Windows desktop versions. REPLY 1: ?. We answer every question we get about this app in detail and fast. We didn't get any question from you. Pls send your question again.

content: Very good üëç
layout for android looks and functions nothing like all the available tutorials so I'll be getting a refund and using an app with better how to instructions
replyContent: This app has 4 versions: iPhone, iPad, Android, Mac(Expert). This is the Android-Advanced version. You prob. saw tutorial videos for the Mac-Expert version, of course that version will look different. The written tutorial on our website explains all of the Advanced-level features of this app, using (almost-identical) iPhone-version screenshots.

content: Don't buy! Bought the app for a tablet, but doesn't fill out screen.stays tiny as it would be on a mobile. Extremely inconvenient. To set and save a hand range takes ages, you can't name them properly and it is absolutely stupid how you have to search them later in a drop down menu. This app might be useful if you want to spend ages trying to tap on possible ranges and calculate them. Unusable for live games.(however to be fair it is not advertised as such) In total: highly overrated, don't buy
replyContent: Is phone-layout app, see screenshots, not tablet. UI stretches some on tablets. Can save/load/name 100 ranges; need scrollable list. Is meant mainly for post-hand analysis. For live hand, using an app on phone/tablet is impractical/unwise; Mac-Expert version of this app would work better. Many ppl. like this app incl. pros/coaches, see our website.

content: A+

For a mobile device it is a good comprehensive tool for range and hand analysis. Very well done, will be using this frequently. I really like the option to save our own custom ranges. Exactly what ive been looking for for mobile!
Amazing. Does what I need it to do.
Great app with great fast responses from the developers! Earlier I wrote a review about a feature not working, turned out I was missing a button and they cleared that up for me! App works flawless!
replyContent: Thanks for updating your review! We will leave our reply to your original question here as it may help other users: After using the Top X% of hands slider, you need to tap the "Add" button to actually add the hands to the range. This slider itself just selects hands, it doesn't actually add them.  Regards, -RJ

content: Not very good for android version. I have a note 8 and it's slow. Would definitely want a refund back for this. Dont hardly use it.
replyContent: About a year ago we doubled the default number of Monte Carlo sim trials that the app does (newer devices are faster and can handle it). For an old phone you can just set the "Number of Sim. Trials" setting to "1/2 x Default". There have been many UI improvements in the last year. Others say it works well on Android. Not sure what more we can do.

content: Need help in terms of tutorial. Went to tge site but aint great help from an Android perspective
replyContent: The written tutorial uses the iPhone version's screenshots, but the Android version has an almost identical UI layout so this should be perfectly OK. The videos (by pros/coaches) use the Mac-Expert version, but the basic concepts they explain e.g. hand ranges apply in all versions of this app. This is nontrivial material; needs good study time ...

content: Very useful. Great app.

went into my app to brush up on my combo draw count, been a bit lazy recently and playing too much verses study, went in and was greeted by an update which was promised there would be before purchase. if you dont want to pay fifty bucks on flopzilla or be tied to a PC then this is perfect app.
Android is running perfect. If you want one touch adding of hands to ranges it's in the options. Really happy with this program
Quick calculations and easy to use once you get the UI down.
Its like having equilab in your phone, absolutely brilliant app and more then worth its price!
I like how I can get the %age when braking down hands. I cant seem to find the app on my phone it starting to tic me off. may uninstall then reinstalling would help
replyContent: Hello, thanks for your review. This seems to be a general Android OS bug on some devices (app icons sometimes disappear from the Home screen). See this link: https://www.technipages.com/android-icons-disappear-from-home-screen  They suggest:1) Restart device. 2) Reset the Home Screen Launcher. See the article for full/more details. Regards, -RJ

content: Too hard to use small buttons and sliders on a phone. Why is this not available for Windows?
replyContent: In the latest update V.12.3.5 we have made just about everything in the UI bigger size (buttons, stats, hand range grid, text). This will help esp. if you're running a very high resolution on your device (see the Settings app). Re. Windows, we prioritized the Apple/Google OS's/devices e.g. we have a Mac(Expert) version, pls see our website/tutorial

content: Wow. This app is amazingly powerful. I've decided recently to move from decent player going by gut feel to an informed player using solid poker math to consistently make +EV decisions. This tool will vault me forward.
replyContent: Thanks for the great review! Just an fyi, the written tutorial on our website should help (http://www.pokercruncher.com/ipPokerCruncherTutorial.html). It uses iPhone version screenshots but the Android version's features are the same. There are also some links to videos made by pros/coaches who use PokerCruncher (Mac-Expert version). Regards, -RJ

content: Android version is useless. wish i hadn't purchased. I was warned by an icon that said "may not be optimized for your device" with the option of "refund" if you have an andriod CHOOSE refund! its useless you'd need tiny fingers to operate.
replyContent: Thanks for being vocal about this. This was indeed an issue when running on very high resolutions (can control this in the Settings app, Display section). In the latest update V.12.3.5 we have made just about everything in the UI bigger size (buttons, stats, hand range grid, text). This will help with this. P.S. Hope your refund went through :).

content: Can't add to my home screen sigh
replyContent: This seems to be a general Android OS bug on some devices (app icons sometimes disappear from the Home screen). See this link: https://www.technipages.com/android-icons-disappear-from-home-screen  They suggest:1) Restart device. 2) Reset the Home Screen Launcher. See the article for full/more details. Regards, -RJ

content: Thank you, just what I needed.

This is the first time that I have given a 5 start rating. The app is great 
and the support is absolutely fantastic. I have used the app for a few 
years now and yesterday I had a question about exporting and importing. I 
contacted support and my questions were resolved in a very timely and 
professional manner. Let me add that the developer continues to improve and 
update the app frequently.

Great app, alot of information, it doesn't scale for tablets which is a 
pity but overall good

This is really superb app, if i may suggest in the future maybe u can add also the stats for deal to turn and river as detailed as deal to flop. It would make this app for more superior than any other app imo. Maybe in the next update haha *fingers cross
replyContent:
Hello,
Thanks for your great review and feedback.
Your feature suggestion is a good idea, but we won't be implementing this in the Android (and iOS) versions of this app because calc'ing these 3 pages of extra stats for the Turn and River is time-expensive (slow). However we have implemented this in the Mac-Expert version of this app.  Regards, -RJ

content: Always using this great little app, very handy indeed.
Simple, smooth interface, does everything flopzilla does on a phone.
It's like having a teacher at ur fingertips response time is almost instant wish I could fix the bugs in my head as fast as they do

I've been using pokerstove on my Android device for too long now. I just downloaded this app less than 5 minutes ago and I'm already in love with it. Of course 5 minutes isn't very long and if I discover any latent defects I will be sure to edit my review... But for now perfect!
The best Android poker app!
Incredible app for learning ranges.
This is my favorite odds calculator. It's quick, super easy to use, clean Up. Great app!
very good app
replyContent: Thanks for updating your review.

content: Love the deal-to-flop stats feature!
GUI looks awkward on my Nexus 5 (1920x1080)...
replyContent:
Hello,
I just realized that there is probably an existing simple solution for this - If your phone's screen is larger than normal, when this app is running the phone's system bar should have an additional "full screen" icon (has 4 outward-pointing arrows). Tapping this icon button should resize/zoom the app to fit the screen well.
Thanks, -RJ

content: Been a massive fan of this app for a few years now. Pretty much everything you need for post game analysis!
Been using this since my iphone days bout 5years and still love it and find it useful.i submitted  a bug report and the developer quickly got on it and updated it. Def recommend.
Having this tool is a blessing. Knowing what to do with the info gathered from it is what's important . 5 stars
replyContent: Thanks for the great review. Yes the key is knowing how to use this app effectively in analyzing real situations. It's a complex topic but to get started on this we've written a tutorial (on our website, link given in app) that uses real life hand situations as motivating examples of how to use this app. Thanks, -RJ/PokerCruncher

content: Tablet UI, would be nicer.

Very handy and complete app! Might not be as feature-rich as FlopZilla, but it is definitely #1 for mobiles! Worth every penny and more. @Devs: why don't you add draws in the stats screen? That'd be the cherry on the pie imho
replyContent: Thanks for your great review! Note that this app does have the feature you're talking about. If you set Deal-To=Flop you get two more pages of stats in the Stats view: odds for flopping draws and combination draws. The Deal-To-Flop feature, when combined with hand ranges, also lets you do flop texture analysis (usually an advanced desktop feature).

content: This is a best number cruncher for holdem. Its like flopzilla and pokerstove made a baby. I have never seen such dedication to a product. Developers who wrote it should not give this app for this cheap. It's hands down amazing.
The math is right on! The features are awesome! Well worth it!
Purchased and downloaded on a samsung tablet  App refuses to work stating its not licenced / purchased                Downloaded onto HTC phone and works
replyContent:
Hello,
From your description ("not licensed") this looks to have nothing to do with Samsung tablets in general, but happened probably because on your Samsung tablet you didn't log in/add your Google id/account on the tablet (under Settings).  So on your tablet the app thought you hadn't purchased the app.  Glad everything's fine on your HTC phone.

content: It's like poker stove for a computer.  So it's better than pokerstoves app.   Great job.   Use it a lot.
Lets you easily select ranges in same manner as pokerstove for each opponent via hand table and sliding range bar, as well as various pre-defined hand groups.

I love this app as it is seamless and made to calculate efficiently. I hate having to get a to a compute or use a clunky mobile browser window to check my math after a questionable play. This app will especially be helpful in tournaments and cash games during breaks to check the math. I like the range vs range features as often you do just want to see if in general against a certain player you were ahead in a particular spot. Really great app guys. If you have space on your team I'd love to work for you too lol!
Is good to go
Best app available for holdem analysis.  ainec.
I use this app then I crush.

I was one of the first users to use this app on iOS when it first launched years ago. Having shifted to Android phone am happy to see this app on Play Store as well. The developer is extremely receptive to feedback. An excellent tool for any level of poker player. Highly recommended!
If you're serious about improving your poker knowledge, then this app is for you.  Thanks PokerCruncher!
This is the best equivalent to poker stove for a droid. I love it. Nice work!
Fantastic but has a small grahics issue on my GS3 running JB... Which were fixed!!!!
replyContent:
Fixed in V.6.1.2:

1) Adjust the vertical positioning of the Equity stats to make sure that they're completely visible under all system font size settings.

Thanks for letting us know about this small UI bug on our TwoPlusTwo forum thread.

content: Great tool for exploring equities whenever.  Much appreciated!
Must have for players who are constantly thinking about ranges when away from Pokerstove
Aesthically very dull but best stats and odds around. AFAIK.
WTF?  ''Application is not licensed''
replyContent:
Updating our reply:

Using profanity, pretty class-less.

Thousands of other customers aren't seeing this and can run this app just fine.

On your device, you need to be signed in as the *same* Google account you used when you purchased this app.

Device's Settings app, Accounts section, verify your Google account. Add a second account if needed.

content: Had this app on my iPhone, best thing since sliced bread, Android app not quite as slick yet, as still quite new, but far better than any other similar app.
Love the deal to feature. Range input a little small. Wish it was easier to input like the other poker equity calc in android. Poker stove for your phone. FINALLY
I almost left Android for an iPhone just for this app.  Thanks!

Great app! I have uninstalled all my other so-called poker calculation apps -- even the paid ones! This one is the best available now.  I do hope that the dev also makes available for android the other iOS poker apps in the product line. Please. Pretty please. Don't make me beg, 'cause I will.
I have purchased this on iOS and now again on android! It's by far the best Android poker odds calculator.
With full support for ranges this is the only equity calculator that's more than just a toy.  Excellent!
